Many of you may have heard about the chaos in Washington over the past week.

Let me take a moment to let you know what’s going on.

PSA: Around 2:20 PM today, every powered-on smartphone, television, and radio in the U.S. will receive an alert as @fema conducts a test of its Integrated Public Alert and Warning System.

Any disruptions will be brief and minimal, and no action on your part will be needed.

House GOP leadership has repeatedly chosen chaos & caving to extremist demands over any real effort to reach across the aisle and solve the problems facing everyday Americans.

You reap what you sow. Today's vote is a direct result of their dysfunction.

I was thrilled today to view the progress of restoration efforts at her former home in Troy, and I’m proud to highlight her inspiring story with this resolution honoring her relentless pursuit of social and economic justice for working women and working families across America.

In 1864, Kate Mullany organized her fellow workers in Troy’s collar industry into the Collar Laundry Union and fought successfully for wage increases and improved working conditions. She later made more history as the first woman to serve as a national labor union officer.

Today, I marked Women’s History Month with the introduction of a resolution to commemorate the life and legacy of Capital Region labor pioneer Kate Mullany — the founder of America’s first all-female labor union.
